trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory Identity Protection Glossary | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory Identity Protection Glossary | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory Identity Protection Glossary
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory Identity Protection Glossary

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory Identity Protection Glossary
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory Identity Protection Glossary

trans-unit.source: At risk (User)
trans-unit.target: At risk (User)

trans-unit.source: A user with one or more active risk events.
trans-unit.target: A user with one or more active risk events.

trans-unit.source: Atypical sign-in location
trans-unit.target: Atypical sign-in location

trans-unit.source: A sign-in from a geographic location that is not typical for the specific user, similar users, or the tenant.
trans-unit.target: A sign-in from a geographic location that is not typical for the specific user, similar users, or the tenant.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Identity Protection
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Identity Protection

trans-unit.source: A security module of Azure Active Directory that provides a consolidated view into risk events and potential vulnerabilities affecting an organization’s identities.
trans-unit.target: A security module of Azure Active Directory that provides a consolidated view into risk events and potential vulnerabilities affecting an organization’s identities.

trans-unit.source: Conditional access
trans-unit.target: Conditional access

trans-unit.source: A policy for securing access to resources.
trans-unit.target: A policy for securing access to resources.

trans-unit.source: Conditional access rules are stored in the Azure Active Directory and are evaluated by Azure AD before granting access to the resource.
trans-unit.target: Conditional access rules are stored in the Azure Active Directory and are evaluated by Azure AD before granting access to the resource.

trans-unit.source: Example rules include restricting access based on user location, device health or user authentication method.
trans-unit.target: Example rules include restricting access based on user location, device health or user authentication method.

trans-unit.source: Credentials
trans-unit.target: Credentials

trans-unit.source: Information that includes identification and proof of identification that is used to gain access to local and network resources.
trans-unit.target: Information that includes identification and proof of identification that is used to gain access to local and network resources.

trans-unit.source: Examples of credentials are user names and passwords, smart cards, and certificates.
trans-unit.target: Examples of credentials are user names and passwords, smart cards, and certificates.

trans-unit.source: Event
trans-unit.target: Event

trans-unit.source: A record of an activity in Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: A record of an activity in Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: False-positive (risk event)
trans-unit.target: False-positive (risk event)

trans-unit.source: A risk event status set manually by an Identity Protection user, indicating that the risk event was investigated and was incorrectly flagged as a risk event.
trans-unit.target: A risk event status set manually by an Identity Protection user, indicating that the risk event was investigated and was incorrectly flagged as a risk event.

trans-unit.source: Identity
trans-unit.target: Identity

trans-unit.source: A person or entity that must be verified by means of authentication, based on criteria such as password or a certificate.
trans-unit.target: A person or entity that must be verified by means of authentication, based on criteria such as password or a certificate.

trans-unit.source: Identity risk event
trans-unit.target: Identity risk event

trans-unit.source: AAD event that was flagged as anomalous by Identity Protection, and may indicate that an identity has been compromised.
trans-unit.target: AAD event that was flagged as anomalous by Identity Protection, and may indicate that an identity has been compromised.

trans-unit.source: Ignored (risk event)
trans-unit.target: Ignored (risk event)

trans-unit.source: A risk event status set manually by an Identity Protection user, indicating that the risk event is closed without taking a remediation action.
trans-unit.target: A risk event status set manually by an Identity Protection user, indicating that the risk event is closed without taking a remediation action.

trans-unit.source: Impossible travel from atypical locations
trans-unit.target: Impossible travel from atypical locations

trans-unit.source: A risk event triggered when two sign-ins for the same user are detected, where at least one of them is from an atypical sign-in location, and where the time between the sign-ins is shorter than the minimum time it would take to physically travel between these locations.
trans-unit.target: A risk event triggered when two sign-ins for the same user are detected, where at least one of them is from an atypical sign-in location, and where the time between the sign-ins is shorter than the minimum time it would take to physically travel between these locations.

trans-unit.source: Investigation
trans-unit.target: Investigation

trans-unit.source: The process of reviewing the activities, logs, and other relevant information related to a risk event to decide whether remediation or mitigation steps are necessary, understand if and how the identity was compromised, and understand how the compromised identity was used.
trans-unit.target: The process of reviewing the activities, logs, and other relevant information related to a risk event to decide whether remediation or mitigation steps are necessary, understand if and how the identity was compromised, and understand how the compromised identity was used.

trans-unit.source: Leaked credentials
trans-unit.target: Leaked credentials

trans-unit.source: A risk event triggered when current user credentials (user name and password) are found posted publicly in the Dark web by our researchers.
trans-unit.target: A risk event triggered when current user credentials (user name and password) are found posted publicly in the Dark web by our researchers.

trans-unit.source: Mitigation
trans-unit.target: Mitigation

trans-unit.source: An action to limit or eliminate the ability of an attacker to exploit a compromised identity or device without restoring the identity or device to a safe state.
trans-unit.target: An action to limit or eliminate the ability of an attacker to exploit a compromised identity or device without restoring the identity or device to a safe state.

trans-unit.source: A mitigation does not resolve previous risk events associated with the identity or device.
trans-unit.target: A mitigation does not resolve previous risk events associated with the identity or device.

trans-unit.source: Multi-factor authentication
trans-unit.target: Multi-factor authentication

trans-unit.source: An authentication method that requires two or more authentication methods, which may include something the user has, such a certificate; something the user knows, such as user names, passwords, or pass phrases; physical attributes, such as a thumbprint; and personal attributes, such as a personal signature.
trans-unit.target: An authentication method that requires two or more authentication methods, which may include something the user has, such a certificate; something the user knows, such as user names, passwords, or pass phrases; physical attributes, such as a thumbprint; and personal attributes, such as a personal signature.

trans-unit.source: Offline detection
trans-unit.target: Offline detection

trans-unit.source: The detection of anomalies and evaluation of the risk of an event such as sign-in attempt after the fact, for an event that has already happened.
trans-unit.target: The detection of anomalies and evaluation of the risk of an event such as sign-in attempt after the fact, for an event that has already happened.

trans-unit.source: Policy condition
trans-unit.target: Policy condition

trans-unit.source: A part of a security policy which defines the entities (groups, users, apps, device platforms, Device states, IP ranges, client types) included in the policy or excluded from it.
trans-unit.target: A part of a security policy which defines the entities (groups, users, apps, device platforms, Device states, IP ranges, client types) included in the policy or excluded from it.

trans-unit.source: Policy rule
trans-unit.target: Policy rule

trans-unit.source: The part of a security policy which describes the circumstances that would trigger the policy, and the actions taken when the policy is triggered.
trans-unit.target: The part of a security policy which describes the circumstances that would trigger the policy, and the actions taken when the policy is triggered.

trans-unit.source: Prevention
trans-unit.target: Prevention

trans-unit.source: An action to prevent damage to the organization through abuse of an identity or device suspected or know to be compromised.
trans-unit.target: An action to prevent damage to the organization through abuse of an identity or device suspected or know to be compromised.

trans-unit.source: A prevention action does not secure the device or identity, and does not resolve previous risk events.
trans-unit.target: A prevention action does not secure the device or identity, and does not resolve previous risk events.

trans-unit.source: Privileged (user)
trans-unit.target: Privileged (user)

trans-unit.source: A user that at the time of a risk event, had permanent or temporary admin permissions to one or more resource in Azure Active Directory, such as a Global Administrator, Billing Administrator, Service Administrator, User administrator, and Password Administrator.
trans-unit.target: A user that at the time of a risk event, had permanent or temporary admin permissions to one or more resource in Azure Active Directory, such as a Global Administrator, Billing Administrator, Service Administrator, User administrator, and Password Administrator.

trans-unit.source: Real-time
trans-unit.target: Real-time

trans-unit.source: See Real-time detection.
trans-unit.target: See Real-time detection.

trans-unit.source: Real-time detection
trans-unit.target: Real-time detection

trans-unit.source: The detection of anomalies and evaluation of the risk of an event such as sign-in attempt before the event is allowed to proceed.
trans-unit.target: The detection of anomalies and evaluation of the risk of an event such as sign-in attempt before the event is allowed to proceed.

trans-unit.source: Remediated (risk event)
trans-unit.target: Remediated (risk event)

trans-unit.source: A risk event status set automatically by Identity Protection, indicating that the risk event was remediated using the standard remediation action for this type of risk event.
trans-unit.target: A risk event status set automatically by Identity Protection, indicating that the risk event was remediated using the standard remediation action for this type of risk event.

trans-unit.source: For example, when the user password is reset, many risk events that indicate that the previous password was compromised are automatically remediated.
trans-unit.target: For example, when the user password is reset, many risk events that indicate that the previous password was compromised are automatically remediated.

trans-unit.source: Remediation
trans-unit.target: Remediation

trans-unit.source: An action to secure an identity or a device that were previously suspected or known to be compromised.
trans-unit.target: An action to secure an identity or a device that were previously suspected or known to be compromised.

trans-unit.source: A remediation action restores the identity or device to a safe state, and resolves previous risk events associated with the identity or device.
trans-unit.target: A remediation action restores the identity or device to a safe state, and resolves previous risk events associated with the identity or device.

trans-unit.source: Resolved (risk event)
trans-unit.target: Resolved (risk event)

trans-unit.source: A risk event status set manually by an Identity Protection user, indicating that the user took an appropriate remediation action outside Identity Protection, and that the risk event should be considered closed.
trans-unit.target: A risk event status set manually by an Identity Protection user, indicating that the user took an appropriate remediation action outside Identity Protection, and that the risk event should be considered closed.

trans-unit.source: Risk event status
trans-unit.target: Risk event status

trans-unit.source: A property of a risk event, indicating whether the event is active, and if closed, the reason for closing it.
trans-unit.target: A property of a risk event, indicating whether the event is active, and if closed, the reason for closing it.

trans-unit.source: Risk event type
trans-unit.target: Risk event type

trans-unit.source: A category for the risk event, indicating the type of anomaly that caused the event to be considered risky.
trans-unit.target: A category for the risk event, indicating the type of anomaly that caused the event to be considered risky.

trans-unit.source: Risk level (risk event)
trans-unit.target: Risk level (risk event)

trans-unit.source: An indication (High, Medium, or Low) of the severity of the risk event to help Identity Protection users prioritize the actions they take to reduce the risk to their organization.
trans-unit.target: An indication (High, Medium, or Low) of the severity of the risk event to help Identity Protection users prioritize the actions they take to reduce the risk to their organization.

trans-unit.source: Risk level (sign-in)
trans-unit.target: Risk level (sign-in)

trans-unit.source: An indication (High, Medium, or Low) of the likelihood that for a specific sign-in, someone else is attempting to use the user’s identity.
trans-unit.target: An indication (High, Medium, or Low) of the likelihood that for a specific sign-in, someone else is attempting to use the user’s identity.

trans-unit.source: Risk level (user compromise)
trans-unit.target: Risk level (user compromise)

trans-unit.source: An indication (High, Medium, or Low) of the likelihood that an identity has been compromised.
trans-unit.target: An indication (High, Medium, or Low) of the likelihood that an identity has been compromised.

trans-unit.source: Risk level (vulnerability)
trans-unit.target: Risk level (vulnerability)

trans-unit.source: An indication (High, Medium, or Low) of the severity of the vulnerability to help Identity Protection users prioritize the actions they take to reduce the risk to their organization.
trans-unit.target: An indication (High, Medium, or Low) of the severity of the vulnerability to help Identity Protection users prioritize the actions they take to reduce the risk to their organization.

trans-unit.source: Secure (identity)
trans-unit.target: Secure (identity)

trans-unit.source: Take remediation action such as a password change or machine reimaging to restore a potentially compromised identity to an uncompromised state.
trans-unit.target: Take remediation action such as a password change or machine reimaging to restore a potentially compromised identity to an uncompromised state.

trans-unit.source: Security policy
trans-unit.target: Security policy

trans-unit.source: A collection of policy rules and condition.
trans-unit.target: A collection of policy rules and condition.

trans-unit.source: A policy can be applied to entities such as users, groups, apps, devices, device platforms, device states, IP ranges, and Auth2.0 client types.
trans-unit.target: A policy can be applied to entities such as users, groups, apps, devices, device platforms, device states, IP ranges, and Auth2.0 client types.

trans-unit.source: When a policy is enabled, it is evaluated whenever an entity included in the policy is issued a token for a resource.
trans-unit.target: When a policy is enabled, it is evaluated whenever an entity included in the policy is issued a token for a resource.

trans-unit.source: Sign in (v)
trans-unit.target: Sign in (v)

trans-unit.source: To authenticate to an identity in Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: To authenticate to an identity in Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Sign-in (n)
trans-unit.target: Sign-in (n)

trans-unit.source: The process or action of authenticating an identity in Azure Active Directory, and the event that captures this operation.
trans-unit.target: The process or action of authenticating an identity in Azure Active Directory, and the event that captures this operation.

trans-unit.source: Sign-in from anonymous IP address
trans-unit.target: Sign-in from anonymous IP address

trans-unit.source: A risk event triggered after a successful sign-in from IP address that has been identified as an anonymous proxy IP address.
trans-unit.target: A risk event triggered after a successful sign-in from IP address that has been identified as an anonymous proxy IP address.

trans-unit.source: Sign-in from infected device
trans-unit.target: Sign-in from infected device

trans-unit.source: A risk event triggered when a sign-in originates from an IP address which is known to be used by one or more compromised devices, which are actively attempting to communicate with a bot server.
trans-unit.target: A risk event triggered when a sign-in originates from an IP address which is known to be used by one or more compromised devices, which are actively attempting to communicate with a bot server.

trans-unit.source: Sign-in from IP address with suspicious activity
trans-unit.target: Sign-in from IP address with suspicious activity

trans-unit.source: A risk event triggered after a successful sign-in from an IP address with a high number of failed login attempts across multiple user accounts over a short period of time.
trans-unit.target: A risk event triggered after a successful sign-in from an IP address with a high number of failed login attempts across multiple user accounts over a short period of time.

trans-unit.source: Sign-in from unfamiliar location
trans-unit.target: Sign-in from unfamiliar location

trans-unit.source: A risk event triggered when a user successfully signs in from a new location (IP, Latitude/Longitude and ASN).
trans-unit.target: A risk event triggered when a user successfully signs in from a new location (IP, Latitude/Longitude and ASN).

trans-unit.source: Sign-in risk
trans-unit.target: Sign-in risk

trans-unit.source: See Risk level (sign-in)
trans-unit.target: See Risk level (sign-in)

trans-unit.source: Sign-in risk policy
trans-unit.target: Sign-in risk policy

trans-unit.source: A conditional access policy that evaluates the risk to a specific sign-in and applies mitigations based on predefined conditions and rules.
trans-unit.target: A conditional access policy that evaluates the risk to a specific sign-in and applies mitigations based on predefined conditions and rules.

trans-unit.source: User compromise risk
trans-unit.target: User compromise risk

trans-unit.source: See Risk level (user compromise)
trans-unit.target: See Risk level (user compromise)

trans-unit.source: User risk
trans-unit.target: User risk

trans-unit.source: See Risk level (user compromise).
trans-unit.target: See Risk level (user compromise).

trans-unit.source: User risk policy
trans-unit.target: User risk policy

trans-unit.source: A conditional access policy that considers the sign-in and applies mitigations based on predefined conditions and rules.
trans-unit.target: A conditional access policy that considers the sign-in and applies mitigations based on predefined conditions and rules.

trans-unit.source: Users flagged for risk
trans-unit.target: Users flagged for risk

trans-unit.source: Users that have risk events which are either active or remediated
trans-unit.target: Users that have risk events which are either active or remediated

trans-unit.source: Vulnerability
trans-unit.target: Vulnerability

trans-unit.source: A configuration or condition in Azure Active Directory which makes the directory susceptible to exploits or threats.
trans-unit.target: A configuration or condition in Azure Active Directory which makes the directory susceptible to exploits or threats.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory Identity Protection
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory Identity Protection
